messages.text:
Maybe this is an issue related to OpenBLAS or gfortran???

```/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lgfortran
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Makefile:165: recipe for target '../libopenblas64_p-r0.3.10.so' failed
make[3]: *** [../libopenblas64_p-r0.3.10.so] Error 1
Makefile:116: recipe for target 'shared' failed
make[2]: *** [shared] Error 2
*** Clean the OpenBLAS build with 'make -C deps clean-openblas'. Rebuild with 'make OPENBLAS_USE_THREAD=0' if OpenBLAS had trouble linking libpthread.so, and with 'make OPENBLAS_TARGET_ARCH=NEHALEM' if there were errors building SandyBridge support. Both these options can also be used simultaneously. ***```
I’m also trying set `export LDFLAGS=-L/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/7/` according to this doc:

<https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/master/doc/build/linux.md>

but, this does not solve my issue… :sob:

messages.text: I’ve reinstalled system and bump to 20.04. Then, I’ve succeeded to build Julia-1.6.0-dev with `USE_BINARYBUILDER=0`. Thank you :tada: .

messages.text: Does anyone know why `make docs` would automatically rebuild the Julia executable if I make any changes to base? Doesn't look like base shows up as a build dependency in the Makefile at all: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/46a0e3e6dd143e012a7fe33b3d50fa12dbe74260/doc/Makefile#L44>

elements.text: would automatically rebuild the Julia executable if I make any changes to base? Doesn't look like base shows up as a build dependency in the Makefile at all:

messages.text:
<https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/46a0e3e6dd143e012a7fe33b3d50fa12dbe74260/Makefile#L94|https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/46a0e3e6dd143e012a7fe33b3d50fa12dbe74260/Makefile#L94>

docs requires Julia-sysimage. Julia-sysimage requires Julia-base
